data.question: What is the publication year of the article discussing the synthesis and crystal structure of a novel one-dimensional halogen-bridged nickel(III)-X-nickel(III) compound?
Based on the atomic parameters provided, how does the isotropic equivalent thermal parameter (Beq) of Ni compare between the structures measured at 25°C and -152°C?
data.answer: The Beq of Ni at 25°C is 1.04 (2) and at -152°C is 0.51 (1), indicating a decrease in Beq with a decrease in temperature.

data.question: True or False: The bond distance between Ni and Br(1) remains almost unchanged when comparing measurements at 25°C and -152°C.
What is the symmetry code for the hydrogen bond N-H...Br(2) in the structure of [Ni(R,R-chxn)2Br]Br2 at 25°C?
How does the isotropic thermal parameter (Beq) of hydrogen atoms change from the structure measured at 25°C to that at -152°C for [Ni(R,R-chxn)2Br]Br2?
data.answer: The Beq values of hydrogen atoms generally decrease from the structure measured at 25°C to that at -152°C, indicating a decrease in thermal motion at lower temperatures.

data.question: True or False: The anisotropic thermal parameters (A2 x10^4) for Ni significantly decrease from the structure measured at 25°C to that at -152°C for [Ni(R,R-chxn)2Br]Br2.
What is the bond angle between Ni-N-C(1) in the structure of [Ni(R,R-chxn)2Br]Br2 at -152°C?
Based on the atomic parameters, how does the bond distance between Ni and Br(1) in [NiBr2([14]aneN4)]C104 compare to that in [Ni(R,R-chxn)2Br]Br2 at 25°C?
data.answer: The bond distance between Ni and Br(1) in [NiBr2([14]aneN4)]C104 is 2.617(1) Å, which is longer than the bond distance in [Ni(R,R-chxn)2Br]Br2 at 25°C, which is 2.580(1) Å.

data.question: True or False: The bond angle Br(1)-Ni-Br(2) in [NiBr2([14]aneN4)]C104 is significantly different from 180 degrees.
What is the bond distance between C(1) and C(2) in the structure of [NiBr2([14]aneN4)]C104 at 25°C?
How does the bond angle N-Ni-N change from the structure of [Ni(R,R-chxn)2Br]Br2 at 25°C to that at -152°C?
data.answer: The bond angle N-Ni-N changes from 186.9(2) degrees at 25°C to 87.3(1) degrees at -152°C, indicating a significant structural change.

data.question: True or False: The isotropic thermal parameter (Beq) for Br atoms in [NiBr2([14]aneN4)]C104 at 25°C is higher than that for Ni atoms.
What is the bond angle between C(2)-N(2)-C(3) in the structure of [NiBr2([14]aneN4)]C104 at 25°C?
Based on the provided atomic parameters, how does the anisotropic thermal parameter for Ni compare between the structures of [Ni(R,R-chxn)2Br]Br2 at 25°C and [NiBr2([14]aneN4)]C104 at 25°C?
data.answer: The anisotropic thermal parameter for Ni in [Ni(R,R-chxn)2Br]Br2 at 25°C is significantly different from that in [NiBr2([14]aneN4)]C104 at 25°C, indicating different levels of anisotropy in their crystal structures.

data.question: True or False: The bond distance between Ni and N(1) in [NiBr2([14]aneN4)]C104 at 25°C is shorter than the bond distance between Ni and Br(1) in the same compound.
What is the publication format of the journal where the article was published?
How does the bond distance between Ni and Br(2) in [Ni(R,R-chxn)2Br]Br2 at -152°C compare to that at 25°C?
data.answer: The bond distance between Ni and Br(2) slightly decreases from 25°C to -152°C, indicating a contraction of the Ni-Br bond at lower temperatures.

data.question: True or False: The bond angle N(1)-Ni-N(2) in [NiBr2([14]aneN4)]C104 at 25°C is less than 90 degrees.
What is the bond angle between Br(1)-Ni-N(1) in the structure of [NiBr2([14]aneN4)]C104 at 25°C?
Based on the atomic parameters, how does the isotropic thermal parameter (Beq) of C(1) compare between the structures of [Ni(R,R-chxn)2Br]Br2 at 25°C and [NiBr2([14]aneN4)]C104 at 25°C?
data.answer: The Beq of C(1) in [Ni(R,R-chxn)2Br]Br2 at 25°C is 1.39 (10), while in [NiBr2([14]aneN4)]C104 at 25°C, it is 2.5, indicating a higher Beq value in the latter.
